posts.post_content:
Clear combo with [Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper), its the same set, and chances are they were probably both in the graveyard theme deck anyhow.  
  
Also goes great with [Kresh the Bloodbraided](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kresh the Bloodbraided), attack and anything that would die anyways, pitch to Kresh

posts.post_content: There are much better things to sacrifice creatures to. [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar), [Carrion Feeder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carrion Feeder), [Fallen Ideal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fallen Ideal), [Attrition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Attrition), [Brion Stoutarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brion Stoutarm), and most notably [Goblin Bombardment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bombardment).
posts.html:
There are much better things to sacrifice creatures to. Ashnod's Altar, Carrion Feeder, Fallen Ideal, Attrition, Brion Stoutarm, and most notably Goblin Bombardment.

@0010:
I was a little depressed that your name did not spell anything, and was just a random assortment of 0's and 1's...

Anyway.. beyond the flavor of this card (a shaman using the blood of a creature to send a spell at something else), i kinda severely don't like this card.. could have been pretty incredible if it didn't need to tap, but otherwise is meh.

Posted By: BastianQoU (7/21/2011 11:30:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Humm, probably in draft could be less horrieble, but defenetly in constructed the ability of tapping make him poor guy. Okey, but anyway as somebody told it can make nice combos with deathkeeper or kresh. You also can eliminate creatures beying passified, I donno, it has a lot of combos, but in fact there a lot of cards whith similar mechanic, but way better... =X
  
   
I will give 3 for it
